structured_data.overview: The General Plan serves as a blueprint for future growth and development of the City, prescribing policy goals and objectives to shape and guide development. It's a comprehensive policy document for future land use decisions and consists of 10 elements.

documents.title: General Plan Introduction
documents.description: Introduction to the city's general plan

documents.description: Element of the general plan focusing on economic development

documents.description: Element of the general plan focusing on land use

structured_data.other_info: The General Plan is made up of 10 elements: Economic Development, Land Use, Circulation, Housing, Open Space and Recreation, Conservation, Air Quality, Noise, Safety, Hazardous Materials and Waste Management. These elements provide the City's foundation guide for planning and identify how land should be used and resources allocated. It is the vision for how the City will evolve and reflects the values and priorities of the community. Free viewers are required for some of the attached documents.
